meanings.sent1: After baking the cake, she needed to remoisten it with a bit of water.
meanings.sent2: The dry sponge was easily remoistened by dipping it in water.
meanings.sent3: He tried to remoisten the stale bread by sprinkling some water on it.
meanings.sent4: The gardener knew just how to remoisten the soil to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent5: The chef quickly learned how to remoisten the pasta to make it tender again.

meanings.definition: To add moisture back to something.
meanings.sent1: She used a spray bottle to remoisten the dry leaves of her houseplants.
meanings.sent2: The baker had to remoisten the dough before shaping it into loaves.
meanings.sent3: The hiker had to remoisten his lips with lip balm in the dry desert.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to remoisten the rubber seal to prevent leaks in the engine.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully remoistened the paint on the canvas to blend the colors smoothly.
